relation: There is a lot to do in your spare time. Bowling, pool, and many more activities.
They have good food. A little pricey though.
I don't live in the dorms.
Study hard, and do the best you can do. Do not get distracted

It is a very good community college. It is a good place to start your education and then transfer to a 4 year university. A lot of degrees and majors available here at the college. And it is not hard to get accepted to.
pageTitle: Navarro College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {9342=I was certainly impressed with the variety of choices Navarro's food and dining has to offer. This year, in the month of March, National Health Month was celebrated by introducing new, healthier food choices in the school's cafeteria. This change was for the interest of those looking for healthier, more vegetarian food choices which is great for a growing college. The college not only hosts a cafeteria, but a deli, as well. Access is simple, fast, and easy. Food portions are aplenty and caters to every culture., 163847=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 106486=I recently visited Navarro College Monday, July 22nd. I loved the tour instructor she was nice, funny, and let me know everything i needed to know about the campus. The school is clean seemed relaxing and like a good environment.}

textAfterTable: Jackson from Waxahachie, TX 11/19/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 2 of 45 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Frugal, introverted, new to college life, interested learners, and those that just want a new degree Tips for prospective students Utilize the Corsicana campus for all financial needs, or learn on your own. Make the most of your experience by doing well in your classes, and definitely go for an associate's degree. The core curriculum required for it will automatically transfer (plus a few more hours) to any Texas school [possibly others, too]. The degree makes it to where the school has to accept 60+ hours of your courses, and it cannot be picked apart. They can, however, throw things out such as orientation, but they still credit you with a few hours from it at the school you transfer to. Bang for the buck The teachers are worth it, and so are some of the staff. However, their financial aid department (on
